page.title: 02Local Place Names
page.content: We found that many of the local villages had an 'ing' as part of their name, such as Margaretting and Ingatestone, and decided to try to find out why. A large area SW of Chelmsford, near the R. Wid, seems to have been known as Gigingas, possibly meaning the 'ing' of Gawo. 'Ing' seems to mean district or possession. After the Norman conquest, the districts were divided up and most were identified by the new owners name. Mountnessing came from the Mounteney family (Mounteney's ing);Ingatestone was probably Ing-at- stone, which refers to the Roman milestone and Fryerning is derived from its association with the Knights Hospitallers (The Hospital of St. John of Jerusalem) who held a small possession there. Members of religious orders tended to be known as friars.
